Reviews.Title: “A great experience in the city of love!”
Reviews.Author: StefanyJackson
Reviews.Content: A great experience in the city of love! For a mega expensive city like Venice, this hotel offers great value. It's much closer to the station than to the main attractions of Venice, but Venice is pretty small and you can walk everywhere (don't waste money on multi trip Vaporetto passes). You can easily walk with your luggage to the hotel from the station too.

Reviews.Title: “A romantic and peaceful place 2 minutes far from Rialto bridge”
Reviews.Author: mathilde_camus
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days in this hotel as the first stop of our honey moon. We parked our car and motorbikes (in a trailer) in a large parking lot in Fusina and we took a boat to arrive in Venise. First impression, everything is beautiful, romantic, with the sun entering the small streets and canals, a beauty. But to find its way in such a labyrinth is not something easy. Anyway we found our ways after 30 minutes of walk and we arrived at the hotel (better would have been to take the nearest regular boat on the grand canal, 6â‚¬ for one way, better value than 120â‚¬ for a gondola). The hotel is placed on a little place with a church, a bar terrace, a little bridge, very cute place as you can see on the pictures of other visitors. We are welcome by a very friendly and helpful person speaking fluently Italian, English and French, who show us our room (the pink room, direct access to the breakfast area). The room is very nice and stylish with a fancy whirlpool, a shower behind the bed, a big bed in the middle of the room, and a ceiling with gorgeous hand-painting decorations. The room is getting on the small place and is very quite (something you should know about Venise is that it is very peaceful and quite place after 10.00pm. So if you like nightlife and party, Venise is definitely not the place. We only found a teeny tiny bar, in a street 500m from the hotel in the direction of rialto bridge, which is offering delicious cocktails like Rhum/fresh strawberry/Basil until 2.00am. It's cold the Geneva. Otherwise you'll have to go to big hotels bars). In the breakfast room you have a small balcony offering a charming view on the canal and the bridge which is next to the hotel. But there is only 1 table which is fitting on that balcony so make sure you are the firsts or the lasts to come to breakfast to have it. ;) If we would have to recommend a hotel in Venise, we would definitely recommend this one. It is not too expensive (in regards with the competition, because sometimes it is really crazy). We would also recommend to stay no longer than 3/4 days in Venise except if you are in love with basilicas and churches and you want to visit the 140 churches that Venise can count. But it is worth it the visit, nowhere else in the world you can find a place which smells that romanticism, mystery and baroque charm.

Reviews.Title: “It could have been good, if only...”
Reviews.Author: Abramovi
Reviews.Content: 1) have wasted time and money to create bad taste decor, like golden painted wall with red lamp, old and new framed mirrors. In one room the bathroom was behind the bed, and door wouldnt seal well, so, might want to ask your partner to step out the room if in need of privacy. 2) better trained staff, friendly, but not handling somel duties. For instance sprayed too strong cleaning product in the room, making impossible to stay, and italian guy in front desk pretended nothing happened and even suggested that tourist were so impressed by the smell that asked him to buy the product themselves. Sure.... 3) climatization was too noise and not working properly 4) breakfast was too simple Overall, its a pitty that a place that could be so much, just, wasnt. For the price paid, expected more.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and Romantic”
Reviews.Author: Prince_Omni
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel and staff. From the time we arrived we were pampered and treated as stars. The junior suite we stayed number 6 was a truly Venetian Style, red covered bed, light under the bed, floor from the old ages very well preserved and overlooking to a small canal on the site. All facilities were great, wifi excellent, the jacuzzi fantastic, the bathroom huge. Very accessible, you take the waterbus number 1, to San Stae stop (the third stop) and then you go to the right of the museum up until you find the first turn left (big bridge to the left). You pass 4 bridges straight and you arrive at a square. Boom your hotel is on the right hand side. Very easy to find but people with heavy luggage might find it difficult to carry them but is a walk of no more than 5-7 minutes. Very close everything. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Venice”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan P
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights. Just a few minutes walk to the Rialto Bridge if you don't get lost and about 15 minute walk to Marks Square. Room size was very good considering its Venice. Clean and comfortable as well. Breakfast was adequate in their dining room. Its located in a small square with an ice cream stand right outside and a very good restaurant just over the little bridge. Would stay here again. Great value for Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TEKPCL
Reviews.Content: The hotel helped out with parking directions. We just parked at Tronchetto and took the boat to the Rialto mercado. It was just a short distance walking to the hotel. The hotel staff were very accommodating, gave good suggestions on sites and nearby restaurants. If you can, walk the city while there, instead of taking the boats.

Reviews.Title: “Baby bed to expensive”
Reviews.Author: MundeleMisterQ
Reviews.Content: We were charged 20â‚¬/night for a baby bed. In all other hotels we stayd with our baby it was free of charge. Moreover, our room was on the ground floor. We regularly heard pumps (or another technical equipment) going on, night and day.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: LapinAParis
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally located on a very quiet square, very nice district. The room was great, modern, calm, not very large but we did have enough space. We chose this hotel because of the design and the jacuzzi in the room, and we weren't disappointed. Staff is efficient and helpful. You can leave you luggage to enjoy your last day in the city. The breakfast was a little bit disappointing, but was OK.

Reviews.Title: “A Dream :-)”
Reviews.Author: emileelouise92
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this hotel. Upon arrival we believed we were going to get one of the rooms with a jacuzzi etc. However, our mistake booked the wrong one and they were easily able to put us in one of the other rooms with a jacuzzi :-) It pretty much made the trip, the room was beautiful, the staff were lovely, the breakfast was gorgeous. I would go back in a heartbeat ! Xxx

Reviews.Title: “Booking confirmations are redundant at this hotel..”
Reviews.Author: Amy1204
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay at the Giuletta and Romeo Hotel 3 months in advance and were looking forward to staying in what looked like a beautiful hotel on the website. After a long trip we arrived at the hotel in the afternoon only to be met by the manager, who advised that there was a black out in our room. Because the hotel was at full capacity he offered us another room at their B&B - Hotel Diamante until the power was restored in our room. We were extremely disapointed because the B&B was of a lower standard to the hotel we had booked and I had splurged on this hotel for my partner's birthday. 2 days later we had heard nothing from the manager so we went back to the hotel and spoke to a man at the reception. When we enquired about the room he told us there were guests in the room. So it became clear that the manager had lied to us and moved us because of a double booking. The man at the reception even admitted to this and told us that it had happening a lot lately.. When we returned to our B&B, the manager was there and when we asked what was happening with our room he told us that the power had still not been fixed. When we told him we were just at the hotel and there were guests staying in the room he became completely irrate and started yelling at us. We were told to leave the B&B and not pay anything and it wouldn't matter to him. It became impossible to discuss the matter with him due to his aggressive manner an he eventually stormed out. We ended up staying at the B&B which was nice and the lady there really looked after us. However our experience at Giulietta & Romeo was terrible and really did spoil our stay in Venice. I would warn anyone against booking with this hotel because chances are you won't end up staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndreyBMoscow
Reviews.Content: Stopped in Hotel in May,2009. Small cosy hotel on 6 rooms, all rooms on 2nd floor. Good big pure rooms in style hi-tech, the big bathrooms, interesting interior. The friendly and attentive personnel: have sent to us by mail to Moscow the nursery of a toy forgotten in room, for what separate thanks from us. By all it is advised!

Reviews.Title: “Arrived at Destination after a long day of travelling only to find that they had moved us to a bed and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: swanneyCanada
Reviews.Content: After a very long day of traveling we arrived at the Il Nido di Giulietta & romeo. We had booked the hotel almost a month in advance and had even emailed them to inform them that we would be arriving around 5 pm. We were told that they did not have a room for us, and that this happened all the time, and that they had changed the location to a bed and breakfast which so happened to be in a totally different location.

Reviews.Title: “Did the bait and switch, beware if you book here”
Reviews.Author: chicagochick72
Reviews.Content: I was very excited to stay in this hotel after reading the great reviews on trip advisor. I called to confirm our reservation two days beforehand because they didnt respond to my confirmation via email. I was assured by the manager that our reservation was in the books. When we arrived, after dragging our luggage from the train station (not advisable), we were informed that the room we had booked had a broken toilet (which I found suspicious) and we had been rebooked in a bed and breakfast. The manager was away for a family emergency and the front desk person couldnt have been any ruder. It was awful. We were there during the film festival and didnt have a choice but to drag our luggage another 20 minutes and go to the b&b. It was clean but there were NO amenities. I am still disappointed that this happened. I went to see the manager before I left and he was very sorry to hear of our experience - and said that they 'accidentally' over booked the hotel. SO the first guy had lied. From what I could tell, the hotel was as advertised but I didnt get any further than the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Wonderful, Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: grcetravler
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel when we stayed there a few weeks ago. The rooms are very modern,, the breakfast room is beautiful and there is a nice spread. Everyone who worked there was very nice and helpful. The hotel is in a cute courtyard that has plenty around and a great location- a 5 min walk (very easy) from the Rialto Mercato waterbus stop. We really loved everything about this place. As a side note, the restaurant that is to the left of the hotel that has the outdoor patio (across the little bridge) is delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, great location”
Reviews.Author: dom84
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not what we expected at all. It was a last minute change of plan due to vacancy problems elsewhere. We stayed in the Mirror room, very modern, if not a bit too holiday inn-ish when staying in Venice and seeking an Italian feel. Bathroom great, very good shower, lovely decor throughout. A bit pricey at 150 euros a night. If you want somewhere clean and a bit cityish this is the place but if like us you're looking for a bit more character stay somewhere a little less upmarket.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I had a different room”
Reviews.Author: ElenaAP
Reviews.Content: When I booked this room ... I couldn't have been more excited. The pictures looked AMAZING and the price was incredibly reasonable. I made a big mistake though ... I assumed that I would have a double bed, not two twin beds (which weren't exactly comfortable considering I was traveling with my significant other). We only stayed for two nights, otherwise I would have asked to be moved. The room was on the ground floor, directly across from the front desk (so beware if you get it and don't want twin beds!!). The breakfast was quite nice, the decor just as I had suspected. There was a flat screen TV mounted to the wall in the room with cable. Everything was wonderful, just wish we had a single bed to sleep in. We could walk from the ferry to the hotel easily, and Venice is so small we walked everywhere without any problems.

HotelInfo.Name: Il Nido di Giulietta & Romeo
HotelInfo.Address: San Polo 1858 | Campo San Cassiano, 30125 Venice, Italy
